page.title: 16Borrowfield,Montrose.
page.content: The{Estates}to the north of Montrose were those of{Borrowfield}and {Newmanswalls.}Before 1408, the Borrowfield property belonged to the Graham family. It was then sold to Mr. Alexander Gardyne whose family held on to it until 1615 when it was sold to Hercules Tailyour. His heirs owned the Estate until 1806 when Elizabeth Tailyour, the wife of Robert Renny, died leaving the property to her son {Alexander Renny Tailyour.}The Newmanswalls property formed part of the ancient hospital grounds of Montrose and was owned by the{Panter family from 1410 to 1636. In 1809 it was sold to Alexander Renny Tailyour.Historically the land has been boggy but was improved to accomodate{farming}before private {housing}was built in the 1960's and the council estate begun in 1971.
